title: Learning spaCy
text:
Vocab, Lexemes and StringStore


Code
import spacy
nlp = spacy.load("en_core_web_sm")

# Shared vocab and string store
nlp.vocab.strings.add("coffee")
coffee_hash = nlp.vocab.strings["coffee"]
coffee_string = nlp.vocab.strings[coffee_hash]
doc = nlp("I love coffee")
print("hash value:", nlp.vocab.strings["coffee"])
print("string value:", nlp.vocab.strings[3197928453018144401])


hash value: 3197928453018144401
string value: coffee




Code
# Lexemes: entries in the vocabulary
doc = nlp("I love coffee")
lexeme = nlp.vocab["coffee"]
# Print the lexical attributes
print(lexeme.text, lexeme.orth, lexeme.is_alpha)


coffee 3197928453018144401 True

title: Learning spaCy
text:
Doc, Span and Token


Code
# Create an nlp object
nlp = spacy.blank("en")

# Import the Doc and Span classes
from spacy.tokens import Doc, Span

# The words and spaces to create the doc from
words = ["I", "like", "David", "Bowie"]
spaces = [True, True, True, False]

# Create a doc manually
doc = Doc(nlp.vocab, words=words, spaces=spaces)
print(doc.text)

# Create a span manually
# span = Span(doc, 0, 2)

# Create a span with a label
# Create a span for "David Bowie" from the doc and assign it the label "PERSON"
span_with_label = Span(doc, 2, 4, label="PERSON")
print(span_with_label.text, span_with_label.label_)

# Add span to the doc.ents (doc's entities)
doc.ents = [span_with_label]

# Print entities' text and labels
print([(ent.text, ent.label_) for ent in doc.ents])


I like David Bowie
David Bowie PERSON
[('David Bowie', 'PERSON')]

title: Learning spaCy
Digital decluttering - Dumbphone attempt
text:
This is my first step of digital declutter process. Do I want to start the day by playing video games and scrolling the short videos or watching long videos? No I don’t. I need some intervention. What can I do to help myself from doing it over and over again? How exactly? Maybe one thing I can do is to start the day with reviewing my todoist list. I don’t want to see stuff that is overdue to be honest.
Adults and teens turn to ‘dumbphones’ to cut screen time
My solution is to switch to a phone with smaller screen. So far it’s the best option, because I had to have a working gps navigation for my car drive. And after I read about all the options for dumbphones, this phone jump out to me. I ordered this one and next step is to get rid of my iphone and ipod, once and for all. Most tasks can be done on my mac, and it’ll be how it works. Including the todo list app I’ve been working with. Jelly Star - The World’s Smallest Android 13 Smartphone https://www.unihertz.com/
In order to get rid of iphone, what do I need to do? https://support.apple.com/en-us/109511

deregister iMessage on both iphon and mac
unpair your Apple Watch
backup the phone
backup the wechat history
manage wechat storage
Let some people know that I will be switching to a non-Apple phone, and suggest them to send me SMS messages. WhatsApp is another alternative, but for long term solution would better be SMS, since it’s going to be useful for a real dumbphone lifestyle.

I just pre-ordered Light phone 3 and hopefully it’ll be my primary phone and Jelly Star can work as a secondary. Remarkable2 is an almost perfect product but it doesn’t support DRM protected ebooks.

title: Digital decluttering - Dumbphone attempt
text:
Prepare for the transition
Eventually the goal is to get rid of IPhone, because it’s not good for my ADHD brain.

Apply greyscale color filters to display
Delete all social media app and games (not sustainable for the following reasons)

even though I know it’s not healthy for me to install them back, but there is nothing to prevent me from installing them again, and it has happend to me numerous times
some social media app I can’t abandon completely because I might lose some contacts by doing that.

For social media app that has TikTok-like feature, delete them all and use website on mac if nessasary.

title: Digital decluttering - Dumbphone attempt
text:
To be continued
And ideally there should be a boring IPhone for people to customize with app store disable. FOMO or not, people should have to option to buy a dumb IPhone. More to come about what that ideal phone should look like. There are some underlying issue there along with it. It’s going to be difficult to overlook.
A list of things an ideal phone should be able to do:

Google Map working on phone and car
Scan QR code and open the website
Text to any other phone with whatever operating system
Compatible with Verizon
Apply greyscale color filters to display
Small screen
Digital Wallet (optional)
ChatGPT (optional)
Option to disable app store / certain apps permanently
Option to disable certain website or only allow certain website permanently
2 step verification app
weather
note
calendar
bluetooth
camera
podcast
music
whatsapp (optional)

title: This was where it began
text:
It was the beginning of 2024. She was wondering what had happened 6 years ago. In order to find the answer, she started to read her text messages between her mother in the middle of the night. It was a night without sleep, literally. As she read through the text messages, she started shaking. She was able to find the answer and something else she never expected.
She never had the patience to actually read previous text messages, since it felt too much work for her. This time she got off a weird phone call, on which her father were being so defensive, evasive and kept telling her she made that decision by herself 6 years ago. Her memory had been so blurry all the time and she never questioned her father before, so she took that as a fact. However, she couldn’t understand why she made that decision no matter how hard she tried to remember. She’d been living through several depression episodes over the last 6 years, she felt like it never left her. And a few darkest time periods were directly related to the decision 6 years ago. Since she believed that she made that decision by herself, hence it’s her fault, she believed she deserve it all, until she finished reading the messages that night.

title: This was where it began
text:
It was the beginning of 2024. She was wondering what had happened 6 years ago. In order to find the answer, she started to read her text messages between her mother in the middle of the night. It was a night without sleep, literally. As she read through the text messages, she started shaking. She was able to find the answer and something else she never expected.
She never had the patience to actually read previous text messages, since it felt too much work for her. This time she got off a weird phone call, on which her father were being so defensive, evasive and kept telling her she made that decision by herself 6 years ago. Her memory had been so blurry all the time and she never questioned her father before, so she took that as a fact. However, she couldn’t understand why she made that decision no matter how hard she tried to remember. She’d been living through several depression episodes over the last 6 years, she felt like it never left her. And a few darkest time periods were directly related to the decision 6 years ago. Since she believed that she made that decision by herself, hence it’s her fault, she believed she deserve it all, until she finished reading the messages that night.

title: This was where it began
text:
When Ultra-Materialism meets Anti-consumerism
She had started working instantly after graduation, since then, she had always been in a full time job, even though not great salary, she don’t need extra money because she’s not interested in chasing after material things. She had always been told by her parents that she’s been so lucky to have them, that they gave her so much and not a lot parents can actually do that. Since then she had not asked money from her parents. They spent money on her education.
